info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 01 at 6:35PM PDT until August 01 at 9:45PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Clark County in southern Nevada... * Until 945 PM PDT. * At 635 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the far northwest Las Vegas Valley near Summerlin and Centennial Hills. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Las Vegas, North Las Vegas, Lone Mountain, Summerlin, Centennial Hills, Spring Valley, North Las Vegas Airport and The Lakes. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
